hints.content:
We need the difference between the baby teeth that $\red{\text{Will}}$ and $\blue{\text{Brynn}}$ have lost, so we will subtract.

$\red{4} - \blue{3} = \green{\Box}$

Or we can see how many more baby teeth $\blue{\text{Brynn}}$ needs to lose to equal the number of teeth $\red{\text{Will}}$ has lost.

$\blue{3} + \green{\Box} = \red{4}$
Will has lost $\green{1}$ more baby tooth than Brynn.

question.content:
Will has lost $4$ of his baby teeth.  Brynn has lost $3$ of her baby teeth.

**How many more baby teeth has Will lost than Brynn?**  

[[â˜ƒ input-number 1]] baby teeth
